alert.note: Alert for Allen; Huntington; Wabash (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:32PM EST until February 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Spy Run Creek at Spy Run Creek near Park Drive At Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Little River above Huntington affecting Wabash, Allen IN and Huntington Counties. .These river rises will shift ice within the river and could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little River above Huntington. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor agricultural flooding is in progress with minimal damage expected. At 15.0 feet, Secondary roads are blocked by flood waters and moderate agricultural flooding is in progress. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 13.1 feet and then begin rising late this afternoon. It will then rise again to 15.0 feet late this evening. It will fall to 13.9 feet and then begin rising just after midnight tonight. It will then rise again to 14.0 feet late tonight. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
